description.raw:
This is starting to address issue #135, regarding performance.

This makes it so the habitat starts empty and is only populated when task 3 checkpoint 3 starts. This means we're not calculating contacts between the tools and the table until then, none of their sensors and plugins have been loaded, and in general, less models means better performance.

Conversely, when task 3 checkpoint 4 starts, all models outside of the habitat are deleted.

Locally, I've seen an improvement on the real time factor in the beginning of a run from around 0.14 closer to 0.21

### How to test it

1. Start `unique.launch`

        roslaunch srcsim unique.launch init:=true

1. Wait for `Init: Done`

1. Look inside the habitat and check that there are no models.

1. Skip to Task 3, Checkpoint 3:

        rosservice call /srcsim/finals/start_task 3 3

1. Look inside the habitat and check that the table and the tools and a bunch of crates were spawned.

1. Skip to Task 3, Checkpoint 4:

        rosservice call /srcsim/finals/start_task 3 4

1. Look outside the habitat, all models should have been deleted (sometimes there might be one bling left, in case the world has 15 instead of 14 blings outside)

Locally, I've seen an improvement on the real time factor in the beginning of a run from around 0.14 closer to 0.21
